thread.title: Pamela Hunter and John Sharon on the Campbell Conversations
thread.title_full: Pamela Hunter and John Sharon on the Campbell Conversations

author: Grant Reeher
title: Pamela Hunter and John Sharon on the Campbell Conversations
text:
Share Twitter Facebook Google+ Email Democrat Pamela Hunter, left, and Republican John Sharon, right, are running for the vacant State Assembly seat in the 128th district, which covers parts of the city of Syracuse and Onondaga County 
The departure of State Assemblyman Sam Roberts for a cabinet post in state government created the need for a special election this November. Two of the candidates vying for the 128th district seat are Democrat Pamela Hunter, a Syracuse Common Councilor and Republican John Sharon, an attorney. On this week's edition of the Campbell Conversations, the two share their views on Syracuse's poverty problem, the proposed increase in the minimum wage, the Common Core, and I-81, among other topics. Listen
